Lap Swim: Open lap swimming for all skill levels. Lanes are shared with other swimmers.
Open Swim: Recreational swimming time for all ages. The entire pool is available for general use.
Quiet Swim: A quieter swimming environment with reduced noise and activity. Ideal for those seeking a calmer aquatic experience.
Adult Swim: Swimming time reserved for adults (18+). A great opportunity for fitness swimming or relaxation.
Deep Water Aerobics: High-intensity water aerobics in the deep end using flotation belts. No swimming skills required. Great cardio workout with zero impact on joints.
Shallow Water Aerobics: Water aerobics in the shallow end of the pool. No swimming skills required. Low-impact cardiovascular workout.
Stroke Improvement: Instruction focused on improving swimming technique for all strokes. Suitable for swimmers who can already swim at least one lap.
Adult Fitness Swim: Structured swim workout for adults looking to improve fitness through swimming.
Zumba: Zumba combines high energy, captivating music with Latin inspired moves that will leave you asking for more. Zumba is a "feel good" total workout, mixing low and high intensity moves for an interval-style, calorie burning dance fitness party! All levels welcome.
Zumba Gold: A modified Zumba class for active older adults or beginners. Lower intensity with easy-to-follow choreography.
ZumbaÂ®: Zumba combines high energy, captivating music with Latin inspired moves that will leave you asking for more. Zumba is a "feel good" total workout, mixing low and high intensity moves for an interval-style, calorie burning dance fitness party! All levels welcome.
Yoga: A practice combining physical postures, breathing techniques, and meditation. Improves flexibility, strength, and mental clarity.
Vinyasa Yoga: A dynamic style of yoga linking breath with movement. Flows through poses in a continuous sequence.
Yoga I: Beginner-friendly yoga class introducing fundamental poses and breathing techniques.
HIIT: High-Intensity Interval Training alternating between intense bursts of activity and fixed periods of less-intense activity or rest.
HIIT Cycle: High-intensity interval training on stationary bikes. Burn calories and build endurance.
Indoor Cycling: Group cycling class on stationary bikes with music and instructor guidance. Great cardio workout.
Total Body Conditioning: Full-body workout targeting all major muscle groups using various equipment and exercises.
Core Training: Focused workout targeting abdominal and back muscles to build core strength and stability.
Meditation: Guided meditation practice for stress reduction, mental clarity, and relaxation.
Ai Chi: A water-based exercise combining Tai Chi concepts with aquatic therapy. Slow, flowing movements promote relaxation and balance.
Barre: Ballet-inspired fitness class using a ballet barre for support. Focuses on small movements to tone muscles.
Pickleball: Drop-in pickleball play. Paddles and balls provided. All skill levels welcome.
Open Gym: Open gymnasium time for basketball, volleyball, or other activities. Equipment may be available.
Full Court Basketball: Full court basketball available for drop-in play.
Pool Closed: The pool is closed during this time for maintenance, cleaning, or private events.
Gym Closed: The gymnasium is closed during this time.
